Package fr.ign.artiscales.pm.decomposition

Class FlagParcelDecomposition

java.lang.Object
fr.ign.artiscales.pm.decomposition.FlagParcelDecomposition
public class FlagParcelDecomposition
extends java.lang.Object
Re-implementation of block decomposition into parcels with flag shape. The algorithm is an adaptation from :

Vanegas, C. A., Kelly, T., Weber, B., Halatsch, J., Aliaga, D. G., MÃ¼ller, P., May 2012. Procedural generation of parcels in urban modeling. Comp. Graph. Forum 31 (2pt3).

As input a polygon that represents the zone to decompose. For each step the decomposition is processed according to the OBBBlockDecomposition algorithm If one of the parcels do not have access to the road, a L parcel is created. A road is added on the other parcel according to 1/ the shortest path to the public road 2/ if this shortest path does not intersect an existing building. The width of the road is parametrable in the attributes : roadWidth

It is a recursive method, the decomposition is stop when a stop criteria is reached either the area or roadwidthaccess is below a given threshold

      Parameters:

      maximalArea - the maximalArea for a parcel
      maximalWidth - the maximal width

    • generateFlagSplitedParcels

      Main way to access to the flag parcel split algorithm.
      Parameters:
      parcelSFC - parcels to cut
      buildingFile - building that could stop the creation of a driveway
      roadFile - complementary roads (as line and not as parcel void)
      profile - type of ProfileUrbanFabric to simulate
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - geomsToCollec() creation

    • generateFlagSplitedParcels

      public static org.geotools.data.simple.SimpleFeatureCollection generateFlagSplitedParcels​(org.opengis.feature.simple.SimpleFeature feat, java.util.List<org.locationtech.jts.geom.LineString> extLines, double harmonyCoeff, double noise, java.lang.Double maximalAreaSplitParcel, java.lang.Double maximalWidthSplitParcel, java.lang.Double lenDriveway, org.locationtech.jts.geom.Geometry exclusionZone) throws java.io.IOException
      Flag parcel split with no buildings and no road.
      Parameters:
      feat - parcel to cut
      extLines - block contour
      harmonyCoeff - possibility for parcel to be elongated or not
      noise - randomness in the parcel creation process
      maximalAreaSplitParcel - area under which a parcel won't be cut anymore
      maximalWidthSplitParcel - with between road and parcel under which parcel won't be cut anymore
      lenDriveway - length of the driveway to simulate
      exclusionZone - Zone to consider as not existing
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - geomsToCollec() creation

    • generateFlagParcel

      private org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<java.util.List<org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon>,​java.util.List<org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon>> generateFlagParcel​(java.util.List<org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon> splittedPolygon)
      Generate flag parcels: check if parcels have access to road and if not, try to generate a road throught other parcels
      Parameters:
      splittedPolygon - list of polygon split with the OBB method
      Returns:
      The output is a pair of two elements:
      • the left one contains parcel with an initial road access and may continue to be decomposed
      • the right one contains parcel with added road access

    • endCondition

      private boolean endCondition​(double area, double frontSideWidth)
      End condition : either the area is below a threshold or width to road (which is ultimately allowed to be 0). Goes to the OBBBlockDecomposition class
      Parameters:
      area - Area of the current parcel
      frontSideWidth - width of contact between road and parcel
      Returns:
      true if the algorithm must stop

    • frontSideWidth

      private double frontSideWidth​(org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon p)
      Determine the width of the parcel on road
      Parameters:
      p - input Polygon
      Returns:
      the length of contact between parcel and road

    • hasRoadAccess

      private boolean hasRoadAccess​(org.locationtech.jts.geom.Polygon poly)
      Indicate if the given polygon is near the shell of a given Polygon object. This object is the islandExterior argument out of FlagParcelDecomposition(Polygon, SimpleFeatureCollection, double, double, double, List, Geometry) the FlagParcelDecomposition constructor or if not set, the bounds of the initial polygon.

      If no roads have been found and a road Geopacakge has been set, we look if a road Geopacakge has been set and if the given road is nearby

      Parameters:
      poly -
